title: MongoDB Security Advanced
subject: MongoDB
theory: Enterprise security features. Encryption at Rest protects disk files. Client-Side Field Level Encryption (FLE) encrypts sensitive fields (SSN) on the client, so the database never sees them in plain text.

examples.explanation: DB admins cannot read the field.

interview_questions.question: What is FLE?
interview_questions.answer: Field Level Encryption. It ensures specific fields are encrypted by the application driver before being sent to the server.

real_world_use_cases.description: Encrypting PII so that a database dump leak doesn't expose user data.

summary: Advanced security protects against sophisticated insider and outsider threats.
